result.execSummary:
The defendant Leland V Ruiz-Gouty was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: DNA proof of submission - original
Payment Notice
Shawano County DNA Proof of Submission - DE signed

Defendant Leland V Ruiz-Gouty in court with attorney Britteny Mae LaFond.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea Questionnaire filed w/NC plea.  ADA Niemi makes recommendation.  Court reviews, rights, charges & penalties w/DE.  DE pleads NC.  Court accepts waiver, plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty.  Victim addresses the Court.  ADA Niemi cites DE's history.  Atty LaFond - agrees w/recommendation.  Court follows recommendation, appeal rights given to DE.

lifted the "no contact"

Defendant Leland V Ruiz-Gouty in court with attorney Britteny Mae LaFond.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No resolution reached.  Schedule FPT and JT.  Victim addresses the court and wants the no contact lifted.   Judge verifies that the victim has gone to Safe Haven.  Judge will amend the bond conditions in this case; however, both parties are reminded of the restraining order--any contact would still be a violation.  (see letter from Judge Habeck in case 15CV117)   Final pre-trial scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 11:15 am.
